subject: Personal Finance
title: The National Debt
description: A 60-second lesson on The National Debt.

hook.text: The US national debt is over $34 trillion. That's over $100,000 per citizen. Should you worry?

buildup.text: National debt is the total amount a government has borrowed over time minus what it's paid back.

discovery.text: Economists measure debt-to-GDP ratio, not raw numbers. The US is at about 120% â€” high but manageable.

twist.text: Japan's debt is 260% of GDP and it hasn't collapsed. Context matters more than scary headlines.

climax.text: The real risk isn't the debt itself â€” it's whether interest payments crowd out spending on everything else.

punchline.text: Debt size matters less than what you can afford to pay.

quiz.question: How do economists typically measure national debt?
options: As a ratio of debt to GDP
